The @EnvAgency  Target for inspecting sewage works in Thames region in 2017 was on average once every EIGHT YEARS. Target 33 achieved 17. Still the leadership cut the monitoring staff. Wondering where it all went wrong? @EmmaHowardBoyd

As a headline those of us in the industries regulated by @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @NatResWales @ScottishEPA know that they are underfunded and/or money is wrongly allocated across the board. https://t.co/A34sOeLa9g

Latest on our exciting smolt-tracking research project with @UofGlasgow @EnvAgencyNW @NaturalEngland Derwent Owners Association & local angling clubs. Hoping to gain new insights into the life-cycle stage where salmon migrate out to sea for the first time:
https://t.co/xSAXtxTa9P https://t.co/dgrduaKOPP

tweets.text: On site today supporting the removal of #Seven side North barrier by the #Worcestershire field operations team and staff from the wider business. @EnvAgencyMids @WorcsTravel #TeamEA https://t.co/AL5FU2m3Bc

A convicted #WasteCrime offender has been ordered to pay ¬£2.1 million.

He had dumped, buried or burned waste totalling about 25,000 cubic metres.

This is one of the highest penalties issued following one of our investigations.

Read more: https://t.co/xWok42h24W https://t.co/j4Tac7rGoc

A member of our team was out surveying for gully blocks on Ilkley Moor, for a Natural Flood Management project, when she saw this glorious gathering of golden plovers ü§©
This #NFM project is being carried out with @EnvAgencyNW & @bradfordmdc https://t.co/Wd3dEuzfFO
A severe flood warning has been issued by @EnvAgency for Bedford. Please take care and follow advice from emergency services. Find out more here https://t.co/kxES0OLNMW

We have been advised by @EnvAgency that the peak of the high water moving down the Great Ouse has now passed through Bedford and Kempston. Working with partners, we're out monitoring the peak as it moves east and responding to requests for assistance. https://t.co/eFodUk2u2s
@ThamesPathNT Flooded Thames at Clifton Hampden today https://t.co/p6irXir4Cl

@Feargal_Sharkey @phlard @stoketran @wessexwater @Theo_Pike @BristolAvonRT @stokestream Plus abject failure of @DefraGovUK and @EnvAgencySW to properly investigate and deal with agricultural pollution. Time for another court case? Winter slurry spreading on waterlogged ground, same time, same place. #pollution Groundhog Day.  @AnglingTrust @wwf_uk @theriverstrust https://t.co/AjLtXvDsi4

River #flooding is possible in parts of central and east England.

Stay alert and keep away from flooded rivers.

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnj1mdd https://t.co/53N5yBFIDE

@Feargal_Sharkey @phlard @stoketran @wessexwater @Theo_Pike @BristolAvonRT @stokestream @DefraGovUK @EnvAgencySW @AnglingTrust @wwf_uk @theriverstrust This is not a criticism of all the EA's brilliant field staff. It is a systemic failure that goes to the root of how we use land and value food and our environment @FFC_Commission @suepritch

Another very good reason to not leave arable fields bare over winter - snow melt is accelerated leading to greater flood risk. @EnvAgency @DaveThroupEA @Nick_Everard @Ian_Maddock https://t.co/744H81fuA1

You can tell that @DefraGovUK isn't serious about protecting our environment when you see that @EnvAgency funding for enforcement activity has halved in the past 10 years
https://t.co/OHEAQXcvZ4 
< no wonder industrial-scale #flytipping and pollution is rife.  Must #StopTheDrop

#TeamEA are working round the clock to check defences and grids. 

With water levels still high, take care not to walk through flood water as it contains hidden dangers such as lifted manhole covers, sharp objects & chemicals

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/MztuI4Ooz5 https://t.co/kWJu7xMMZ1
@michaelgwebster As @ZoeLenkiewicz says, definitions will be key! We will all be looking to @EnvAgency @ScottishEPA @NatResWales for their views pretty quickly I think!

#Bewdley Bridge reopen üëç

@worcscc @WyreForestDC @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/sAyCQKKjsF
@DrColinChurch Will be interesting to watch impact...any idea what "almost free from contamination" means?

tweets.text:
@phlard @stoketran @wessexwater @suesustainable @Theo_Pike @BristolAvonRT @stokestream The primary reason, a rather massive lack of investment in infrastructure the last 30 years, ie in 2019 @wessexwater spent 107,435 hours dumping sewage into local rivers. 

As for testing it? Not a chance. Just dump it.

Shocking to see the stark reality of repeated budget cuts to @EnvAgency. I hope @CommonsEAC inquiry on Water Quality in #Rivers will ask the gov't if it will be matching its #environmental ambition with proper investment in its Agencies. @Dunne4Ludlow @JamesBevanEA @MarianSpain https://t.co/qTTc5ixXUK

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/HCws1Z2qjR
